title: Uniform Generation of Random Regular Graphs.
abstract: We develop a new approach for uniform generation of combinatorial objects, and apply it to derive a uniform sampler REG for $d$-regular graphs. REG can be implemented such that each graph is generated in expected time $O(nd^3)$, provided that $d=o(\sqrt{n})$. Our result significantly improves the previously best uniform sampler, which works efficiently only when $d=O(n^{1/3})$, with essentially the same running time for the same $d$. We also give a linear-time approximate sampler REG*, which generates a random $d$-regular graph whose distribution differs from the uniform by $o(1)$ in total variation distance, when $d=o(\sqrt{n})$.
